article:
There is no other city in the world that has such a strong connection with the Olympic Games. Athens, the  _  city of the first modern Olympics in 1896,   _   into the limelight   again on March 30,2008   _   the flame for that year's Olympic Games was   _   over to the Beijing Organizing Committee. The Olympic flame was   _   on March 24,2008 in Olympia, a place in southwestern Greece. In the ritual  , actresses   _   as ancient Greek priestesses   used a   _   to light the flame. The flame then was carried to the site of public ceremony and handed to the first   _  , Greek taekwondo  athlete Alexandros Nikolaidis. He carried the flame to the   _   of the monument of Baron de Courbertin, the   _   of the modern Olympic Games.
Athens was named   _   Athena, the goddess of wisdom in Greek mythology  . It is also one of the world's oldest cities with a history   _   at least 3,000 years. Athens was the   _   of arts, learning and philosophy in ancient times and is widely   _   to as the cradle   of Western civilization.
The heritage of history is   _   evident in the city, represented by a number of ancient monuments and works of art. The Acropolis   is the city's key   _  . It overlooks the   _   city and dominates the skyline  . The main temple of the goddess Athena,   _   on the Acropolis, was Parthenon  . And the National Archaeological Museum, the   _   important museum in Greece, holds a priceless   _   of treasure, with artifacts   of almost every culture, which flourished   in the Mediterranean  .
